title: Fix typed-word counting edge case, polish landing/results layouts, and remove Donate section

requirements.text: Fix the typed-word counting so that a level reports 0 typed words until the user has entered at least one non-whitespace character that remains (i.e., do not count 1 typed word when the input is empty, and do not count a word if the user typed it and then deleted it before clicking “Next Level”). Update all UI counters/progress and any gating logic that depends on typed-word counts to use this corrected logic.

quotes: Looks like if user dhasn't typed any character for a level, the app still counts 1 typed word for that level so make sure 0 typed words are counted until user types at least a character and doesn't delete the word before clicking "Next level"

acceptanceCriteria: With an empty input (no characters typed), the on-screen “Words typed” count shows 0 (not 1).
If the user types characters and then deletes them so the input becomes empty again, the “Words typed” count returns to 0.
Clicking “Next Level” with an empty input does not record/reflect 1 typed word anywhere in the level’s progression or displayed counters.
Progress calculation does not advance when the input is empty (progress remains 0%).

requirements.text: Adjust the landing page layout so the “Top Players” card and the “Get Started” card each visually match the combined size of two of the smaller feature cards (“5 Levels”, “Earn XP”, “Win ICP”) when viewed on typical desktop breakpoints, creating a more professional, balanced layout.

quotes: For the landing page make sure the "Top Players" box and "Get Started" box both match the size of the smaller "5 Levels" "Earn XP" and "Win ICP" boxes added together so that page looks professional

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop (md and up), the “Top Players” card height matches the height of two stacked small feature cards (within reasonable visual tolerance).
On desktop (md and up), the “Get Started” card height matches the height of two stacked small feature cards (within reasonable visual tolerance).
Spacing, alignment, and card sizing look consistent across the section (no obviously mismatched card heights or awkward gaps).
On mobile/small screens, the layout remains readable and does not overflow horizontally.

requirements.text: Polish the test results (post-challenge completion) layout so the WPM display fits on a single line when it reads “not available (test duration < 60 secs)”, and adjust the surrounding stat boxes to maintain a professional, consistent appearance.

quotes: For the test results, modify the size of the box containing WPM so that "not available (test duration < 60 secs) appears on a single line and make sure to adjust the other boxes as well so that page looks professional

acceptanceCriteria: When the test duration is under 60 seconds, the WPM value text “not available (test duration < 60 secs)” renders on a single line (no wrapping).
The results stat cards/tiles remain visually consistent (padding, alignment, and sizing) after resizing the WPM tile.
The results layout remains responsive and does not overflow on small screens.

requirements.text: Remove the “Donate here” section from the app’s footer area/landing view for now (remove the UI block showing “Donate here:” and the donation account id).

quotes: remove the "Donate here" section from the footer for now

acceptanceCriteria: The UI no longer shows any “Donate here:” text anywhere in the footer/landing page area.
No donation account id is displayed in the UI.
The rest of the landing page spacing looks intentional after removal (no large empty gap where the section was).

constraints: Frontend files listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT must not be edited (compose existing UI components instead).
Keep all changes within the existing single-actor Motoko backend architecture; do not introduce additional backend services.
nonGoals: Implementing ICP ledger integration, real prize transfers, or enabling the currently-stubbed wallet/prize flows.
Changing authentication (Internet Identity) behavior or role/access-control policies.
Redesigning unrelated pages beyond the landing page and the post-challenge results layout adjustments requested.
